required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating A 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine Administered to Infants in Taiwan
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-Blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine In Healthy Infants Given With Routine Pediatric Vaccinations In Taiwan

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), relative to a 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) when given concomitantly with routine vaccines in Taiwan.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Antibody Level of Greater Than or Equal to 0.35 Micrograms (Mcg)/mL, 1 Month After the Infant Series.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the infant series (7 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a predefined antibody level of greater than or equal to 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding exact 95% confidence interval (CI) for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Antibody Level of Greater Than or Equal to 0.35 Mcg/mL, 1 Month After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after toddler dose (16 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a predefined antibody level of greater than or equal to 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding exact 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

intervention.description: 13vPnC is given via intramuscular injection at approximately 2, 4, 6, and 15 months of age.
7vPnC is given via intramuscular injection at approximately 2, 4, 6, and 15 months of age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy 2-month-old infants (42 to 98 days)
- Available for the entire study period (14 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccination with pneumococcal, diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, or Hib vaccines
- A previous anaphylactic reaction to any vaccine or vaccine-related component.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited in Taiwan from June 2008 to Nov 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 169 subjects were screened, 168 subjects were randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to either the 13vPnC group (n=84) or the 7vPnC group (n=84).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Antibody Level of Greater Than or Equal to 0.35 Micrograms (Mcg)/mL, 1 Month After the Infant Series.
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a predefined antibody level of greater than or equal to 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding exact 95% confidence interval (CI) for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the infant series (7 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had treatments as randomized at all 3 doses, blood drawn within specified timeframes, had at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for the proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Antibody Level of Greater Than or Equal to 0.35 Micrograms (Mcg)/mL, 1 Month After the Infant Series.
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving a predefined antibody level of greater than or equal to 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding exact 95% confidence interval (CI) for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had treatments as randomized at all 3 doses, blood drawn within specified timeframes, had at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for the proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Exact, unconditional, 2-sided 95% CI for the difference in proportions were computed using the noninferiority procedure of Chan and Zhang, using the standardized test statistics and gamma=0.000001.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC) for Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody, 1 Month After the Infant Series
outcome.description: Antibody GMC as measured in mcg/mL for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had treatments as randomized at all 3 doses, blood drawn within specified timeframes, had at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for the proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

measure.description: Antibody GMC as measured in mcg/mL for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population: had treatments as randomized at all 3 doses, blood drawn within specified timeframes, had at least 1 valid and determinate assay result for the proposed analysis, and no major protocol violations.

analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence intervals for the ratio are back transformations of a confidence interval based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithms of the measures (13vPnC-7vPnC reference).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 1 (2 Months of Age).
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling and redness present); Mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after Dose 1 of the infant series (2 Months of Age)
outcome.population: Safety population: all participants who received dose 1 of the infant series vaccination (2 months of age). (n)= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 1 (2 Months of Age).
measure.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling and redness present); Mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: Safety population: all participants who received dose 1 of the infant series vaccination (2 months of age). (n)= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

analysis.groups_desc: For Tenderness - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Tenderness - Significant, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Swelling - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Swelling - Mild, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Swelling - Moderate, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Mild, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Moderate, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 2 (4 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling and redness present); Mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 Days after Dose 2 of the infant series (4 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety population: all participants who received the first 2 doses of the infant series vaccination (4 months of age). n= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days for each treatment group respectively.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC, administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). At 2 and 4 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with a commercially available combination vaccine containing: diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTaP); inactivated poliovirus (IPV); and H influenzae type b (Hib). At 6 months of age during the infant series, 7vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 2 (4 Months of Age)
measure.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling and redness present); Mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: Safety population: all participants who received the first 2 doses of the infant series vaccination (4 months of age). n= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days for each treatment group respectively.

analysis.groups_desc: For Tenderness - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Tenderness - Significant, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Swelling - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Swelling - Mild, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Any, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Mild, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Redness - Moderate, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Local Reactions: Infant Series Dose 3 (6 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling and redness present); Mild (0.5 to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after Dose 3 of the infant series (6 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety population: all participants who received all 3 doses of the infant series vaccination (6 months of age). n=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days for each treatment group respectively.

At 6 months of age during the infant series, 13vPnC was co-administered with DTaP-IPV-Hib and hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccine.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Systemic Events: Infant Series Dose 1 (2 Months of Age)
outcome.description: Systemic events (any fever >=38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after Dose 1 of the infant series (2 months of age)
outcome.population: Safety population: all participants who received dose 1 of the infant series vaccination (2 months of age). (n)= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series) and 15 months of age (toddler dose). analysis.groups_desc: For Fever >=38 but <=39 degrees C, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.
For Fever >39 but <=40 degrees C, Fisher exact test was used to calculate p-value.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline through 1 month after last study vaccination (16 Months). Local reactions and systemic events assessed within 4 days of dose: Infant Series Dose 1=2 months of age; Dose 2=4 months of age; Dose 3=6 months of age; Toddler Dose=15 months of age.
reported_events.desc: An Adverse Event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and = non-serious for another subject or subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious episode of the same event

group.title: Infant Series 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received 1 single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC), administered intramuscularly, at 2, 4 and 6 months of age (infant series). certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Geometric Mean Concentration Outcome Measures were identified as secondary analysis in the study protocol, but are included to maintain consistency with other postings for this program.
